is.workflow.actions.output.name: Stop and Output
is.workflow.actions.output.description:
Stops execution of the current shortcut, and outputs content. This action is useful when:

 Running a shortcut from another shortcut (using the Run Shortcut action). The output will be used as the output of the Run Shortcut action.
 Running a shortcut from Quick Actions in Finder on macOS. The output will be saved as a file alongside the files selected in Finder.
 Running a shortcut from Services on macOS. The output will replace the selected content, if applicable.
 Or, when running a shortcut from another location that supports output, like the command-line or the Shortcuts URL scheme.

No more actions will be run after this action.
is.workflow.actions.output.parameters_doc:
Stop and Output [Result]

If theres nowhere to output:
[Do Nothing / Respond / Copy to Clipboard]

WFSSHScript: osascript -e 'on run {input, parameters}	tell application "Freeform" to activate	tell application "System Events"		keystroke "N" using {command down, shift down}	end tell	return inputend run'

Region: [Text]

Script:
on run {input, parameters}
	tell application "Feedback Assistant" to activate	tell application "System Events"		keystroke "c" using {command down, shift down}	end tell	return inputend run
on run {input, parameters}	tell application "Developer" to activate	tell application "System Events"		delay 1		keystroke "f" using {command down, control down}	end tell	return inputend run
on run {input, parameters}	tell application "Freeform" to activate	tell application "System Events"		keystroke "N" using {command down, shift down}	end tell	return inputend run
on run {input, parameters}	tell application "Mail" to activate	tell application "System Events"		keystroke 1 using {command down}	end tell	return inputend run
on run {input, parameters}	tell application "System Events"		keystroke "f"	end tell	return inputend run
on run {input, parameters}	tell application "System Events"		keystroke "f" using {command down, control down, option down}	end tell	return inputend run

on run {input, parameters}	tell application "System Events" 
delay 1
keystroke "f" using {command down, control down}
delay 1
keystroke "f"
end tell	return inputend run

on run {input, parameters}	tell application "System Events" 
delay 1
keystroke "f" using {command down, control down}
end tell	return inputend run
tell application "System Events"	keystroke "0" using {shift down, command down}end tell
tell application "System Events"	keystroke "U" using {shift down, command down}end tell
